about_the_game:
Gray city. Dirty panels. Bald flower beds. Not only asphalt will not survive this winter...

Death and life are closer than it seems.

Before you, “Walls” is a deep and intriguing visual novel in the post-punk style, which invites you to plunge into the dark and mysterious world of St. Petersburg through the eyes of a lost poet, Slava.

History of Glory

Slava is a former student, broken and destroyed by life. After a difficult breakup and expulsion from the university, he finds himself deeply depressed and comes to thoughts of suicide. However, before ending his worthless life, he needs to complete his will. This turns out to be quite a difficult task. Write down all your experiences and history on one piece of paper.... Slava needs to think carefully.

Journey through the Shadows

The player will go on a mystical journey with Slava, exploring his tragic past and his shitty present, meeting ghosts, reflecting on life and the purpose of man.

Lots of Possibilities

The player is asked to make decisions that will affect the development of the plot. Each decision brings you closer to one of eight possible endings, all of which carry a deep undertone of melancholy and tragedy. And only in one of them will Slava survive this night.

Glory's journey in "Walls" is full of hidden dangers and surprises. Will the secrets of his house be revealed to him? Can he find inspiration for his will? Will he be able to do anything useful? It all depends on your decisions.

Take control of the dark side of St. Petersburg

The game "Walls" introduces you to the world of St. Petersburg, immersed in darkness and despair, through the original post-punk doomer style. Explore a gray and depressing city, meet lost souls and explore the dark corners of its existence.

Can you help Slava find the way to the light in this world of shadows? Or was his fate already decided a long time ago?

Take on the challenge of "The Walls" and enter this dark world full of intrigue and tragedy.

content_descriptors.notes: The game contains suicide, depressive behavior, mentions of childhood abuse and russian dumer
